== Main Inclusion Report for liblastfm ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libl/liblastfm]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures or some subset ?
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed for Amarok 2.2 to use last.fm
** Build dependency of amarok
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=liblastfm|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=liblastfm|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root, no daemons
** Network activity: does not open port, does handle incoming network data (code in ws/ws.cpp uses QDomDoc)
** Does process including structured data from last.fm
** No known source code review
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out the box
** No debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:liblastfm|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libl/liblastfm.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://github.com/mxcl/liblastfm/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://github.com/mxcl/liblastfm/issues|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: nothing significant
** Does not deal with hardware
** test suite is run during build
0. ''UI standards:''
** No user visible strings (some included but not used by Amarok)
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system cdbs
0. ''Dependencies:''
** qt4, libfftw3-dev, libsamplerate-dev, ruby
** all in main
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Unlikely to need much maintinance, we can sync from Debian in future versions
** Kubuntu team will monitor quality
** JonathanRiddell is bug contact in Ubuntu
0. ''Background information:''
** general purpose and context is clear
** upstream call it liblastfm
